title: How to Make Citrus Punch

steps.headline: Wash the grapefruit, orange and lemon.
steps.description: Cut them into wedges, peel the skin off the mandarin, and separate the flesh into wedges as well. Squeeze each fruit into the cocktail glass until the glass is approximately half-full. Only use half of the lemon, all the orange, half of the grapefruit and all the mandarin.

steps.headline: Add as much Lemonade or Limeade as desired but make sure not to overfill.
steps.description: Taste the mixture; if too sour, squeeze more mandarin juice into the glass.

steps.headline: Add some honey in if desired and mix the punch with a spoon.
steps.description: If the punch is too sweet, add some water and mix.

steps.headline: Add a few ice cubes and garnish the glass with a lemon or lime wedge or pineapple wedge and a Paper Cocktail Umbrella to impress any guest.
Place a straw inside the glass and start sipping!

text: Lemonade\/Limeade Method: Wash the grapefruit, orange and lemon. Cut them into wedges, peel the skin off the mandarin, and separate the flesh into wedges as well. Squeeze each fruit into the cocktail glass until the glass is approximately half-full. Only use half of the lemon, all the orange, half of the grapefruit and all the mandarin. Add as much Lemonade or Limeade as desired but make sure not to overfill. Taste the mixture; if too sour, squeeze more mandarin juice into the glass. Add some honey in if desired and mix the punch with a spoon. If the punch is too sweet, add some water and mix. Add a few ice cubes and garnish the glass with a lemon or lime wedge or pineapple wedge and a Paper Cocktail Umbrella to impress any guest.  Place a straw inside the glass and start sipping!  Coca-Cola Method: Wash the orange and lemon. Cut them into wedges. Squeeze each fruit into the cocktail glass until the glass is approximately a quarter full. Only use half of the lemon and all the orange. Add as much Coca-Cola as desired but make sure not to overfill. Taste the mixture; if too sour, add honey into the glass. Mix the tumbler. Add a few ice cubes and garnish the glass with a lemon or lime wedge and a Paper Cocktail Umbrella to impress any guest. Place a straw inside and start sipping!
